introduction.title: Welcome to our robot factory!
content: As a supervisor, your task will be assemble and train robots to perform various tasks.
But before you can start, you need to go through mandatory training that will teach you how these robots work.

introduction.title: How do robots learn?
content: The robots in this facility learn using machine learning techniques, primarily neural networks and reinforcement learning.
To understand how they learn, let's first look at neural networks - one of the core systems powering their decision-making.

introduction.title: What is a neural network?
content: A neural network is made of layers of connected nodes that transform input data, adjust internal parameters, and improve with training.
This allows the robot to recognize patterns, make decisions, and enhance its performance over time.

introduction.title: Your first task
content: Before you start to create fully functional robots, you need to prove that you know how to create and use neural networks.
Your first task is to set up a basic neural network and explore its architecture to understand how it processes and learns from data.

introduction.title: Instructions
content: Start by opening the workshop.
You can use the workshop to configure, validate, and train your neural networks.
If you are unsure about any part of the workshop, click on the label to view a description of its function.
Now, try to click on the INPUT section to see what it does.
Good job! Now you are ready to configure your first network.
Every neural network needs to have some nodes in INPUT, HIDDEN and OUTPUT layers
Try by adding nodes in each layer, then press the "Test" button to check if the network is valid.

firstNetworkNotValid.title: Task incomplete
content: The basic neural network has not been set up yet. Return to the workshop and complete the network setup by adding input, hidden, and output layers.

firstNetworkValid.title: Task completed!
content: Congratulations, you have set up your first neural network and learned about its architecture.
Next, you will build a network for our sorting robot so that it can classify parts into the correct categories.

firstNetworkValid.title: Your second task
content: Each incoming part has three properties: weight, durability, and material type.
Your neural network needs to analyze these properties and correctly determine what kind of robot it belongs to.

firstNetworkValid.title: Helpful hints
content: Match input nodes to properties of robot parts and output nodes to prediction of robot types.
Stacking two hidden layers can help the network learn more complex patterns.
Use a small number of nodes in each hidden layer and adjust as needed.
Set up the network and try to validate it, before we proceed to the training.

secondNetworkNotValid.title: Task incomplete
content: The neural network is not yet set up to classify robot parts. Return to the workshop and complete the network setup by adding input, hidden, and output layers.

secondNetworkValid.title: Task completed!
content: You successfully set up a neural network that can classify robot parts.
Now, you will need to train the network.

secondNetworkValid.title: How training works?
content: Training begins by pressing the "Train" button.
Before starting, you can set the number of training cycles and the learning rate using input fields on the right.
Adjust the training parameters, then switch to the Evaluation panel to review your network’s performance.

secondNetworkTrainedBad.title: Task incomplete
content: The training of your network did not go well.
Maybe you should try to increase the number of training cycles.
Keeping the learning rate low can also help the network learn better.

secondNetworkTrainedGood.title: Task completed!
content: You successfully set up a neural network that can classify robot parts.
Now, this network can be used as a brain of our sorting robot.

secondNetworkTrainedGood.title: Your third task
content: Now we will move to a different section of our factory, where you will learn more practical applications of machine learning.
Open evaluation panel and press the "Next Level" button to continue.

ReinforcementLearning.title: Welcome to our RL tile-based game!
content: In this game, you will train a robot to navigate a tile-based environment.
The type of machine learning used in this game is called reinforcement learning.

ReinforcementLearning.title: What is reinforcement learning?
content: Reinforcement learning is a type of machine learning where an agent learns to make optimal decisions by interacting with its environment.
The agent receives feedback in the form of rewards or penalties based on its actions, which helps it learn and improve over time.

ReinforcementLearning.title: How does it work?
content: In reinforcement learning, the learning is done step by step.
- The agent is presented a state,
- It takes an action
- And receives a reward.
A "state" is a representation of the environment at that moment.
The agent chooses an action based on its current state and receives a reward based on the action it took.
When the agent picks an action that we consider good, it receives a positive reward.
If the action is bad, it receives a negative reward.
The agent goes through multiple iterations of this process, learning from its experiences and improving its performance over time.
Try opening up the workshop window to see how the robot is set up.

RLWorkshop.title: Your new task!
content: Here, you will be able to set up the robot's reward parameters and train it to learn how the environment impacts it.
You can adjusts the reward values for each special tile presented in the level.
The robot will receive a reward based on the value you set for the tile it steps on.
When you're ready to train the agent, press the "Play" button to begin the training.
You can also speed up the training by pressing one of the different speed options.

RLWorkshop.title: Level 1
content: For this level, you need to set up the reward values for the tiles, such that the robot can learn to navigate the environment and reach the goal.
How well your setup performs will be evaluated based on the robot's ability to reach the goal efficiently.
Adjust the rewards and start the training.

RLPuzzleCompleted.title: Training completed!
content: The training has been completed. Now open the evaluation tab to see the outcome of the training.

RLPuzzle1Solved.title: Task completed!
content: You successfully set up the reward values for the tiles, allowing the robot to learn to navigate the environment and reach the goal.
When you are ready, proceed to the next level.

RLPuzzle1NotSolved.title: Task incomplete
content: The reward values were not optimized for the robot to learn to navigate the environment and reach the goal.
Return to the workshop and give it another try.

RLPuzzle2.title: Level 2
content: For this level, you need to set up the reward values for the tiles, such that the robot can learn to defeat its enemies by taking a buff and then attacking them.
How well your setup performs will be evaluated based on the robot's ability defeat both enemies.
There are some additional parameters next to the reward adjusters that you can adjust inside the workshop window.
These settings will affect the training process of the robot.
The "Learning Rate" determines how strongly the reward values effect the robot's learning process.
If it’s too high, the robot might never settle on a good solution. If it’s too low, it learns super slowly and might get stuck with a bad solution.
The "Steps" parameter determines how many steps the robot is allowed to take before a single iteration ends.
Adjusting this parameter could help the robot explore the environment more thoroughly, but it also makes the training longer.
The "Episode" parameter determines how many iterations the robot will train through, before it is evaluated.
Adjusting this parameter could make the tranining more efficient, but it also makes the training longer.
Depending on how you set these parameters, will affect the training time and the robot's performance.
Try to find the best combination of parameters that will allow the robot to learn efficiently.

RLPuzzle3.title: Level 3
content: For this level, you need to set up the reward values for the tiles, such that the robot can learn to grab collectibles and reach the goal.
There will be enemies in the level that the robot should try and avoid.
How well your setup performs will be evaluated based on the robot's ability navigate efficiently.
In this case, the robot is more likely to make random actions in the beginning to explore different possible states and their effects.
This helps the robot to learn about the environment and find the best actions to take.
As the robot learns, it will gradually shift towards exploitation, where it will choose the actions that yield the highest rewards based on its learned experiences.
The "Decay Rate" parameter determines how quickly the robot will shift from exploration to exploitation.
A higher decay rate means the robot will quickly start exploiting its learned experiences, while a lower decay rate means it will continue exploring for a longer time.
Try to find the best combination of parameters that will allow the robot to learn efficiently.

RLPuzzle2Solved.title: Task completed!
content: You successfully set up the reward values for the tiles, allowing the robot to learn to defeat its enemies by taking a buff and then attacking them.

RLPuzzle2NotSolved.title: Task incomplete
content: The reward values were not optimized for the robot to learn to defeat its enemies by taking a buff and then attacking them.
Return to the workshop and give it another try.

RLPuzzle3Solved.title: Task completed!
content: You successfully set up the reward values for the tiles, allowing the robot to learn to grab collectibles and reach the goal.

RLPuzzle3NotSolved.title: Task incomplete
content: The reward values were not optimized for the robot to learn to grab collectibles and reach the goal.
Return to the workshop and give it another try.
